// Base class: Circle
class Circle {
public double radius; // public to allow access in the derived class

public Circle(double radius) {
this.radius = radius;
}

public double area() {
return Math.PI * Math.pow(radius, 2);
}
}

// Derived class: Cylinder
class Cylinder extends Circle {
public double height;

public Cylinder(double radius, double height) {
super(radius); // Call the constructor of the base class (Circle)
this.height = height;
}

public double volume() {
// Use the area method from the base class and multiply by height
return area() * height;
}
}

// Example usage
public class Main {
public static void main(String[] args) {
double radiusCircle = 5;
double heightCylinder = 10;

// Create an instance of the Circle class
Circle circleObject = new Circle(radiusCircle);

// Display the area of the circle
System.out.println("Area of the circle: " + circleObject.area());

// Create an instance of the Cylinder class
Cylinder cylinderObject = new Cylinder(radiusCircle, heightCylinder);

// Display the volume of the cylinder
System.out.println("Volume of the cylinder: " + cylinderObject.volume());
}

System.out.println("Precentage of this student is ");
System.out.println(Final + "%");


}

}else if(percentage > 60) {

}

}

=30-17
=13

=12-34*2
=12-68
=-56

System.out.println(s.substring(0));

System.out.println(s.replace('a','&')); //return string
System.out.println(s.replace("a","&+*"));


System.out.println(s.startsWith("m"));//return boolean
System.out.println(s.endsWith("i"));

System.out.println(s.charAt(0));//give char at given index
System.out.println(s.indexOf("an"));//return index of given substring :start index
System.out.println(s.indexOf("an",4));//return index of given substring :fron specified index
System.out.println(s.indexOf("an000"));//return -1 if not found
System.out.println(s.lastIndexOf("an"));//start from last return last index
System.out.println(s.lastIndexOf("an",4));//start from last only search from 4 from last

System.out.println(s.equals("Manjirian"));//return boolean if string are equal or not
System.out.println(s.equalsIgnoreCase("ManjIRian"));//it will check without case sensitivity




}

}

boolean b = true;

System.out.println("for logical and (&&) operator\n");
if (a && b){
System.out.println("Both is True");
}
else {
System.out.println("one or both is False");
}

System.out.println("\n**************************");
System.out.println("for logical or (||) operator\n");
if(a || b){
System.out.println("one or both is True");
}
else{
System.out.println("Both is False");
}
System.out.println("\n**************************");
System.out.println("for logical not (!) operator\n");
System.out.print("(a) is not ");
System.out.println(!a);
System.out.print("(b) is not ");
System.out.println(!b);
}

{

package com.packagee;

import java.awt.font.FontRenderContext;

public class CWH_24_break_and_continue {
public static void main(String[] args) {
//Break n continue using loops!
System.out.println("This is for loop and break statement\n-----------------------");
for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {

System.out.print(i);
System.out.println("java is great");
if (i == 2) {
System.out.println("Exiting the loop ");
break;
}
}

//using break with d0-while loop
int i = 0;
System.out.println("----------------------------\n\t\tThis is while loop and break statement");


do {
System.out.print(i);
System.out.println("java is great");
i++;
if (i == 2) {
System.out.println("Exiting the loop ");
break;
}
}while (i!=5);


////////////////////////////////////// CONTINUE STATEMENT ///////////////////////////////////

for ( i = 0; i < 5; i++){
System.out.print(i + " : Hello ");
if (i == 2){
System.out.println("This is continue, the remaining code wont work");
continue;
}
System.out.println("bye");



}




}
}

public class multi_dim_arrays {
public static void main(String[] args) {
int[][] flats = new int[2][3];
flats[0][0] = 101;
flats[0][1] = 102;
flats[0][2] = 103;
flats[1][0] = 201;
flats[1][1] = 202;
flats[1][2] = 203;

System.out.println("Length of the array: " + flats.length);
// for-each loop.
System.out.println("Display using for-each loop method: ");
for (int[] n : flats) {
for (int m : n) {
System.out.print(m+" ");
}
System.out.println("\n");
}
}

sum = b-a;
}

}

}

import java.util.Scanner ;

public class Patternsample {
static void sum() {

System.out.println("there are some present");

}

return a ;
}

Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
//System.out.println(" Enter number a & b ");

int b = 77;
int c;
sum();
sum(a);
}

Encapsulation : Putting up different things and consider it as a single component.

class setperimetre
{
private int radius=0;
private double area=0;
private double circumference=0;
//for Radius
public void getradius(int x)
{
if(x>0)
radius=x;
}
public int giveradius()
{
return radius;
}
// for Area
public void getarea(double x)
{
double y=22*radius*radius/7;
if(x==y)
area=x;
}
public double givearea()
{
return area;
}
//for circumference
public void getcircumference(double x)
{
int y=2*22*radius/7;
if(x==y)
circumference=x;
}
public double givecircumference()
{
return circumference ;
}
}

package com.company;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.Random;

class RSP{
int chances;
char player_choice;
char computer_choice;
int player_points = 0;
int computer_points = 0;
String player_name;
int tye_points = 0;

public void lineMaker(int len){
for (int i = 0; i < len; i++){
System.out.print("-");
}
}
public void finalScoreBoard(){
lineMaker(20);
System.out.println();
System.out.printf("computer score : %d\n", computer_points);
System.out.printf("%s score : %d\n", player_name, player_points);
System.out.printf("Tye %d times.\n", tye_points);

System.out.print("FINAL : ");
if (player_points > computer_points){
System.out.printf("%s WON THE GAME\n", player_name);
}
else if (player_points < computer_points){
System.out.println("computer WON THE GAME.");
}
else {
System.out.println("NO ONE WIN GAME TYE");
}
lineMaker(20);
System.out.println();
}
public void currentScoreboard(String winner){
lineMaker(10);
System.out.print(" Current Score Board ");
lineMaker(10);
System.out.printf("\n%s choose %c, computer choose %c\n", player_name, player_choice, computer_choice);
System.out.printf("%s win this round.\n", winner);
System.out.printf("computer score : %d\n", computer_points);
System.out.printf("%s score : %d\n", player_name, player_points);
System.out.printf("Tye %d times.\n", tye_points);
if (player_points > computer_points){
System.out.printf("%s is leading [by scores].\n", player_name);
}
else if (player_points < computer_points){
System.out.println("computer is leading [by scores].");
}
else {
System.out.println("No one leading state : TYE");
}
lineMaker(20+" Current Score Board ".length());
System.out.println();
}
public void winProcessor(){
if (computer_choice == player_choice){
tye_points += 1;
lineMaker(20);
System.out.println("\nGame Tye");
lineMaker(20);
System.out.println();
}
else if ("RPS".indexOf(player_choice) == -1) {
computer_points += 1;
lineMaker(20);
System.out.printf("\n%s Wrong Input, computer got this point\n", player_name);
lineMaker(20);
}
else if (computer_choice == 'R' && player_choice == 'P') {
player_points += 1;
currentScoreboard(player_name);
}
else if (computer_choice == 'P' && player_choice == 'S') {
player_points += 1;
currentScoreboard(player_name);
}
else if (computer_choice == 'S' && player_choice == 'R') {
player_points += 1;
currentScoreboard(player_name);
}
else {
computer_points += 1;
currentScoreboard("computer");
}
}
}

public class RockPaperScissorsOop {
public static void main(String[] args) {
RSP game = new RSP();
Random random_obj = new Random();
Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

System.out.println("Enter your name :");
game.player_name = input.nextLine();

System.out.println("Enter chances of play :");
game.chances = input.nextInt();

for (int i = 0; i < game.chances; i++){
game.computer_choice = "RPS".charAt(random_obj.nextInt(0, 3));
System.out.println("Enter your choice\nfor Rock R\nfor Paper P\nfor Scissors S\n>>> ");
game.player_choice = input.next().charAt(0);
game.winProcessor();
System.out.println("\n");
}
game.finalScoreBoard();
}

mul1*=(3.1415f)*a*a;

}

class CircleCir {
private float radius;
private float area;
private float perimeter;

// Setter method for radius
public void setRadius(float r) {
radius = r;
}

// Setter method for area
public void setArea(float a) {
area = a;
}

// Setter method for perimeter
public void setPerimeter(float p) {
perimeter = p;
}

// Method to check if the provided area matches the calculated area
public void checkArea() {
if (area == 3.14f * radius * radius) {
System.out.println("Right area");
} else {
System.out.println("Wrong area");
}
}

// Method to check if the provided perimeter matches the calculated perimeter
public void checkPerimeter() {
if (perimeter == 2 * 3.14f * radius) {
System.out.println("Right perimeter");
} else {
System.out.println("Wrong perimeter");
System.out.println(2 * 3.14f * radius);
}
}
}

public class Circle_2 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
CircleCir ci = new CircleCir();

// Set the radius, area, and perimeter values for the circle
ci.setRadius(10);
ci.setArea(314);
ci.setPerimeter(62.800003f);

// Check if the provided area and perimeter are correct
ci.checkArea();
ci.checkPerimeter();
}
}

}
}

public class Employee {
private String name;
private int salary;

// Default constructor
public Employee() {
this.name = "Unknown";
this.salary = 10000; // Initialize salary to Rs 10,000
}

// Constructor with name and salary parameters
public Employee(String name, int salary) {
this.name = name;
this.salary = salary;
}

// Getter methods for name and salary
public String getName() {
return name;
}

public int getSalary() {
return salary;
}

// Setter methods for name and salary (if needed)
public void setName(String name) {
this.name = name;
}

public void setSalary(int salary) {
this.salary = salary;
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
// Create an Employee object using the default constructor
Employee emp1 = new Employee();
System.out.println("Employee 1:");
System.out.println("Name: " + emp1.getName());
System.out.println("Salary: Rs " + emp1.getSalary());

// Create an Employee object using the constructor with parameters
Employee emp2 = new Employee("John", 15000);
System.out.println("\nEmployee 2:");
System.out.println("Name: " + emp2.getName());
System.out.println("Salary: Rs " + emp2.getSalary());
}
}

private String name;
private double salary;

//Default Constructor
public ConstructorOverloading(){
name = "Unkown";
salary = 10000.0; // initialize salary of 10000
}

//Constructor with parameters
public ConstructorOverloading(String employeeName){
name = employeeName;
salary = 10000.0;
}

//Constructor with name and salary parameter
public ConstructorOverloading(String employeeName , double initialSalary ){

name = employeeName;
salary = initialSalary;

}
public void display_Employee_info(){
System.out.println("Name: "+ name);
System.out.println("RS." + salary + "/-");
}


public static void main(String[] args) {
ConstructorOverloading emp1 = new ConstructorOverloading();
emp1.display_Employee_info();

ConstructorOverloading emp2 = new ConstructorOverloading("John");
emp2.display_Employee_info();

ConstructorOverloading emp3 = new ConstructorOverloading("Alice", 15000.0);
emp3.display_Employee_info();


}

import java.util.Random;
import java.util.Scanner;

class Number {
private int num = 0;
private int userInput;
private int count = 0;

public Number() {
Random random = new Random();
this.num = random.nextInt(100);

}

public boolean isCorrectNumber() {
if (userInput == num) {
{
System.out.println(" <<--- Hurray !! You Got The Number --->>");
return true;
}
} else if (userInput > num) {

count++;
System.out.println("Your guess is greater than Number");
return false;
} else {
System.out.println("Your guess is smaller than Number:- ");
count++;
return false;

}

}

public void takeUserInput() {
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
this.userInput = sc.nextInt();

}


public void noOfGuesses() {
System.out.println("Actual Number Was :- " + num);
System.out.println("You guess The Number in :- " + count + " Times");

}
}

public class Number_guess {
public static void main(String[] args) {
System.out.println("<<<<<< --------- Number Guessing Game --------- >>>>>>");
System.out.println("<<<<<< --- Please Input Your Guess Number b/w(0 - 100 ) --- >>>>>>");
System.out.print("Started ......");
boolean status = false;
Number player = new Number();
while (true) {
player.takeUserInput();
status = player.isCorrectNumber();
if (status == true) {
player.noOfGuesses();
break;
}
}

}

class Cylinder{
private double radius;
private double height;

private double p = Math.PI; // or Approx Value 3.14;

private int length;

private int width;

Cylinder(double radius, double height){
this.radius=radius;
this.height=height;
}

Cylinder(int length, int width){
this.length = length;
this.width = width;
}

Cylinder(double radius){
this.radius=radius;
}


public double getRadius() {
return radius;
}

public void setRadius(double radius) {
this.radius = radius;
}

public double getHeight() {
return height;
}

public void setHeight(double height) {
this.height = height;
}

public double getP() {
return p;
}

public void setP(double p) {
this.p = p;
}

public int getLength() {
return length;
}

public void setLength(int length) {
this.length = length;
}

public int getWidth() {
return width;
}

public void setWidth(int width) {
this.width = width;
}

public double surfaceArea(){
double result = (2*p*radius*height)+(2*p*radius*radius);
return result;
}

public double volume(){
double result = p*radius*radius*height;
return result;
}

public double area(){
double result = length* width;
return result;
}

public double perimeter(){
double result = 2*(length+width);
return result;
}

public double surfaceAreaSphere(){
double result = 4*p*radius*radius;
return result;
}

public double volumeSphere(){
double result = (4*p*radius*radius*radius)/3;
return result;
}



}

package com.practice;

import java.util.Scanner;

class CylinderC{
private double height, radius;
CylinderC(double height, double radius){
this.height=height;
this.radius=radius;
}
double[] Get(){
double[] hr = {height, radius};
return hr;
}
}
public class GetConst {
final double pi = 3.1415926535897;
double Vol(double h, double r){
CylinderC obj = new CylinderC(h,r);
double[] arr = obj.Get();
return pi*Math.pow(arr[0], 2)*arr[1];
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.print("Enter Radius: \n");
double h = sc.nextDouble();
System.out.print("Enter Height: \n");
double r = sc.nextDouble();
System.out.println("Volume is: "+new GetConst().Vol(h,r));
}

double Volume(double h, double r){
Cylinder C = new Cylinder();
C.SetC(r);
C.SetCh(h);
double V = pi*Math.pow(C.GetC(),2)*C.GetCh();
return V;
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.print("Enter Height in m: \n");
double h = sc.nextDouble();
System.out.print("Enter Radius in m: \n");
double r = sc.nextDouble();
System.out.println("Volume of cylinder is: "+new GetS().Volume(h,r)+" Cubic m");
}

class Sphere{
private double Area;
private double Volume;
private int Radius;



public Sphere() {
this.Radius = 15;
}

public Sphere(double area, double volume, int radius) {
this.Area = Area;
this.Volume = Volume;
this.Radius = Radius;
}

public double SurfaceArea() {
//A=4πr^2
return 4 * Math.PI * Radius * Radius;
}

public double Volume() {
//V=4/3πr^3
return 4/3D * Math.PI * Radius * Radius * Radius;
}

}

Thank you liked Comedy line:- [5:20] Iska Matlab kya hua samje Daya😂😂 Concept crystal clear ChatGpt helps also Dynamic method dispatching in Java is a concept that allows different objects of related classes to be treated as objects of their common superclass at runtime. It enables polymorphism, which means that a single method call can execute different implementations based on the actual type of the object being referred to, rather than the reference type.

Here's an easy-to-understand explanation:

Imagine you have a superclass called "Animal" and two subclasses called "Dog" and "Cat" that inherit from the "Animal" class. Each of these subclasses has its own implementation of a method called "makeSound()". Now, let's say you have an array of "Animal" objects that can hold instances of both "Dog" and "Cat".



class Animal {
public void makeSound() {
System.out.println("Animal makes a sound");
}
}

class Dog extends Animal {
public void makeSound() {
System.out.println("Dog barks");
}
}

class Cat extends Animal {
public void makeSound() {
System.out.println("Cat meows");
}
}

public class Main {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Animal[] animals = new Animal[2];
animals[0] = new Dog();
animals[1] = new Cat();

for (Animal animal : animals) {
animal.makeSound(); // Dynamic method dispatching based on the actual type of the object.
}
}
}


In this example, we have an array of "Animal" objects that can store instances of both "Dog" and "Cat". When we loop through the array and call the "makeSound()" method on each object, the actual implementation that gets executed depends on the runtime type of the object, not the reference type.

The first element in the array is a "Dog" object, so when we call "makeSound()" on it, it prints "Dog barks".
The second element in the array is a "Cat" object, so when we call "makeSound()" on it, it prints "Cat meows".
This dynamic determination of the method to be executed at runtime based on the actual object type is known as dynamic method dispatching. It allows for flexibility and extensibility in object-oriented programming, as new subclasses can be added without affecting existing code that uses the superclass reference. 5.40 - 6.20 Ye Wala part Sab se Maja Aaya mere Ko Abbtak ka sama se Jada Favourite Series 😊 Love Harry Bro Hi Harry, What if we want to call parent class on method using dynamic method dispatch? import java.util.Scanner;

//Create a class Game, which allows a user to play "Guess the Number" game once.
//
//Game should have the following methods:
//Constructor to generate the random number
//takeUserInput() to take a user input of number
//isCorrectNumber() to detect whether the number entered by the user is true
//getter and setter for noOfGuesses
//Use properties such as noOfGuesses(int), etc to get this task done!
class guess_the_number_game {
public int random_number;
int number_of_guesses = 0;

guess_the_number_game(){
System.out.println("Welcome to the guessing GAME.\n Guess the number between 1 to 100 in as less tries as possible. \n GOOD LUCK.\n");
int random = (int) (Math.random() * 100 ) +1;
random_number = random;
//System.out.println(random_number);
take_user_input();
}
public void take_user_input(){
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
int number;
System.out.println("Guess the number:- ");
number = sc.nextInt();

if(number == random_number){
number_of_guesses += 1;
System.out.println("Yeahhhhh. You got it right in " + number_of_guesses + " tries");
if (number_of_guesses == 1){
System.out.println("WOWWWWW. You scored 100%. Looks like I've found GOD.");
}
else if(number_of_guesses <= 7){
System.out.println("Congratssss, You took only " + number_of_guesses + " tries. Give me party now.");
}
else{
System.out.println("You took " + number_of_guesses + " tries. Not bad. Can you do better? ");
}
}
else {
if(number<random_number){
System.out.println("Your guessed number is smaller. ");
number_of_guesses += 1;
take_user_input();
}
else {
System.out.println("Your guessed number is larger");
number_of_guesses +=1;
take_user_input();
}
}
}
}
public class guess_the_number {
public static void main(String[] args) {
guess_the_number_game g1 = new guess_the_number_game();
}

public class GuessNumber {
int chooseNumber;
int randomNumber;
Random rand = new Random();
int upperbound = 101;
int randomNumber = rand.nextInt(upperbound);

public void setNumber(int n) {
if (n < 0 || n > 100) {
System.out.println("Out of Bounds! Please choose a number between 0 and 100 for a better experience.");
} else {
chooseNumber = n;
}
}

public int checkNumber(int guess) {
if (guess < 0) {
System.out.println("You lose.");
return -1;} else if (chooseNumber > randomNumber) {
System.out.println("The chosen number is greater!");
System.out.println("You have " + guess + " chances remaining.");
return checkNumber(guess - 1);
} else if (chooseNumber < randomNumber) {
System.out.println("The chosen number is smaller!");
System.out.println("You have " + guess + " chances remaining.");
return checkNumber(guess - 1);
} else {
System.out.println("Congratulations! You guessed the number in just " + guess + " chances.");
return chooseNumber;
}
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
GuessNumber game = new GuessNumber();
int guess = 5;
while (guess > 0) {
System.out.print("Choose a number: ");
int chosenNumber = sc.nextInt();
game.setNumber(chosenNumber);
int result = game.checkNumber(guess);
if (result != -1) {
break;
}
}
}
} //my code for this game question

import java.util.Random;
import java.util.Scanner;
class game{
int x;
int num;
game(){
Random r = new Random();
this.x = r.nextInt(200-100)+100;
}
public void takeuserinput(){
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
this.num = sc.nextInt();
}
public boolean isCorrectNumber(){
if(this.num == this.x){
return true;
}
else{
return false;
}
}
public void approach(){
if(this.num > this.x){
System.out.println("You Guess greater number...think lesser number.");
}
else if(this.num < this.x){
System.out.println("You Guess lesser number...think greater number.");
}
}

}

public class Ex3_GuessNo_ {
public static void main(String args[]){

System.out.println("--------------------Welcome to GUESS THE NUMBER Game--------------------");
System.out.println();
System.out.println("Here you have to guess a number between 100 to 200");
System.out.println("You have only 10 chances to guess the number : ");
System.out.println();
System.out.println("LETS START......");
System.out.println();
game g = new game();
int chance = 10;
for(int i=0; i<10; i++){
if(chance==0){
System.out.println("SORRY! You failed to guess the number");
System.out.println("The Number was : "+g.x);
System.out.println();
System.out.println("----------THANK YOU----------");
break;
}
else{
System.out.print("Guess Number : ");
g.takeuserinput();
if(g.isCorrectNumber()){
System.out.println("Congratulations!! You Guess the Correct number;");
break;
}
else{
g.approach();
}
chance--;
System.out.printf("-----%d Chances are Left-----\n",chance);
}
}
}

class Game // CLASS
{
int ran; // Variable to store random number
int userNum; // Variable to store User INPUT
int NooFGuesses= 0; // Variable to store number of Guesses


public void Game() // Constructor for Generating Random Number
{
Random random = new Random();
int x = random.nextInt(0,100);
ran = x ;
}

public void Restart() // Method to Restart the game if in case user inputs a invalid number
{
int U ;
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.println("ENTER A NUM");
U= sc.nextInt();
userNum = U ;
Start();
}
public void Start() // Method where game runs
{

if(userNum >= 100) {
System.out.println("Invalid Number \n " +

"Enter a Number in Between 0 and 100\n " +
"Game has Restarted... ");
Restart();
}
else if(userNum>ran)
{
System.out.println("Your Number is greater than Computer Number......Please Enter a lesser Number");
NooFGuesses +=1;
Restart();
} else if (userNum<ran)
{
System.out.println("Your Number is lesser than Computer Number......Please Enter a greater Number");
NooFGuesses +=1;
Restart();
}
else if(userNum == ran)
{
System.out.println("Yeeah...Congratulation You have Guessed it Right :)\n " +
"You Guessed it in " + NooFGuesses+ " chances");

}

}
}

takeUserInput(){

{

{

else if(UserInput < randomNumber)
{

}
return false;
}

public void checking(){

{
correctUserInput();

break;
}
else if (UserInput != randomNumber) {
setUserInput();
}
}
}
public void continueProgram (){
new takeUserInput();
changeRandomNumber();
checking();
exit();
}

public boolean exit(){

System.out.println("thanks for playing with us ");
return true;
}
else {
System.out.println("the game is continuing");
continueProgram();
return false;

}
}
}

unum = sc.nextInt();
}

public String check() {

if (number == unum) {
return "right guess";
} else if (unum > number) {
return "try less number";
} else {
return "try greater number";
}
}
}

int attempt = 0;
game obj = new game();
while (str != "right guess") {

obj.user_input();
str = obj.check();
System.out.print(str + "\n");
attempt++;
}

System.out.println("you have passed in " + attempt + " attempt");

}

class Guess{

private int noOfGuesses;
int comp;
int user;
public Guess(){
System.out.print("The lower limit is set to 0, provide an upper limit for the computer : ");
int upper = sc.nextInt();
comp=ran.nextInt(upper+1);
}
public void takeUserInput(){
System.out.print("Enter Your Guess : ");
user=sc.nextInt();
isCorrectNumber();
}
public void getGuess(){
System.out.println("No of Guesses : "+noOfGuesses);
}
public void setGuess(){
noOfGuesses++;
}
public void isCorrectNumber(){
if(comp==user) {
System.out.println("You have guessed the number correctly !!");
setGuess();
getGuess();
}
else if (user>comp){
System.out.println("Your guess is greater than the correct number. Try guessing a lower number !!");
setGuess();
takeUserInput();
}else{
System.out.println("Your guess is lower than the correct number. Try guessing a greater number !!");
setGuess();
takeUserInput();
}
}
}
public class Guess_The_Number {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Guess g = new Guess();
g.takeUserInput();
}

And thanking You for this Free Service you are providing us ❤ Thank you Sir overiding is there in abstract class and normal classes also right. what is big difference in terms of use?

The primary difference lies in the intention and design of using these classes:

Abstract Classes:

Abstract classes are meant to define a common structure or interface for a group of related classes.
They can have both abstract methods (without implementation) and concrete methods (with implementation).
Subclasses of an abstract class must provide implementations for all its abstract methods, which enforces consistency and ensures that all derived classes adhere to a common contract.
Abstract classes are useful when you want to establish a foundation with shared behaviors while allowing subclasses to specialize and extend those behaviors.
Regular (Concrete) Classes:

Regular classes provide complete implementations for all their methods.
Subclasses of a regular class can inherit and use methods from the parent class, but they can also override those methods to provide their own implementations if needed.
Regular classes are useful when you have a single class that you want to extend without enforcing a common structure or contract among its subclasses. They allow for more flexibility in method implementations in each subclass.
In essence, abstract classes are used to define a consistent structure among related classes and ensure that certain methods are implemented by all subclasses. Regular classes are used when you want to provide a base implementation that can be extended or overridden as needed without enforcing a strict contract.

Ultimately, the choice between abstract and regular classes depends on the design goals and requirements of your application. It's about finding the right balance between enforcing structure and allowing flexibility in your class hierarchy.

// Interface for Camera
interface Camera {
void takePhoto();
void recordVideo();
}

// Interface for GPS
interface GPS {
void navigate();
}

// Interface for Media Player
interface MediaPlayer {
void play();
void pause();
}

// Superclass for Mobile
class Mobile {
private String brand;

public Mobile(String brand) {
this.brand = brand;
}

public void makeCall(String number) {
System.out.println("Calling " + number);
}

public void receiveCall(String number) {
System.out.println("Receiving call from " + number);
}
}

// Subclass SmartPhone using all the superclasses and interfaces
class SmartPhone extends Mobile implements Camera, GPS, MediaPlayer {
public SmartPhone(String brand) {
super(brand);
}

@Override
public void takePhoto() {
System.out.println("Taking a photo");
}

@Override
public void recordVideo() {
System.out.println("Recording a video");
}

@Override
public void navigate() {
System.out.println("Navigating using GPS");
}

@Override
public void play() {
System.out.println("Playing media");
}

@Override
public void pause() {
System.out.println("Pausing media");
}
}

public class Main {
public static void main(String[] args) {
SmartPhone myPhone = new SmartPhone("XYZ Brand");

myPhone.makeCall("123456789");
myPhone.receiveCall("987654321");
myPhone.takePhoto();
myPhone.recordVideo();
myPhone.navigate();
myPhone.play();
myPhone.pause();
}
}

}

}

}
}

Thank you sir 💗💗 sir aapto saakshaath devtha ho // Interfaces ......... Can crate properties in interfaces and Can't modify properties

abstract class Yamaha{
void tyres(){
System.out.println("Yamaha has 2 tyres");
}
void steering(){
System.out.println("Yamaha has 1 steering");
}
abstract int chooseSpeed(int speed);
}

interface BikeF1{ //BikeF1 means 1st feature of Bike...folows....
void speedUp(int increment);
void speedDown(int decrement);
}

/*
interface BikeF2{
void horn1();
void horn2();
}
*/

interface BikeF3{
void gearUp(int increment);
void geardown(int decrement);
}

class Fz extends Yamaha implements BikeF1, BikeF3{
public void speedUp(int increment){
System.out.println("The speedUp is "+ increment);
}
public void speedDown(int decrement){
System.out.println("The speedDown is " + decrement);
}
public void gearUp(int increment){
System.out.println("The gear should go when speed goes Up " + increment);
}
public void geardown(int decrement){
System.out.println("The gear should go down when speed goes Down " + decrement);
}
int chooseSpeed(int speed){
return speed;
}
}

public class Interfaces{
public static void main(String [] args){
Fz myfz= new Fz();
myfz.speedUp(100);
myfz.gearUp(5);
myfz.speedDown(20);
myfz.geardown(2);
System.out.println("My Yamaha Fz speed should be " + " " + myfz.chooseSpeed(200) + "KMPH");
}
}

/*
Output:
The speedUp is 100
The gear should go when speed goes Up 5
The speedDown is 20
The gear should go down when speed goes Down 2
My Yamaha Fz speed should be 200KMPH
*/ thank you Thanks Harry amazing Thank You ❤️❤️❤️ amazing video harry bhai I am the king of coding.

interface Camera{

}
default void record4kVideo(){
greet();

}
}
interface Wifi{
String[] getNetworks();
void connectToNetwork(String network);
}
class cellPhone{

}
void pickCall(){
System.out.println("Connecting...");
}
}
class MySmartPhone extends cellphone implements Camera, Wifi{

}
public void recordVideo(){

}

}

}

interface Parser {
void file();

int[] bits();
}

interface Compiler extends Parser {

void eliminateWhiteSpaces();

void syntaxAnalysis();

void codeOptimisation();

void generateParseTree();
}

class VsCode implements Compiler {

public void eliminateWhiteSpaces() {
System.out.println("Eliminated all white spaces");
}

public void syntaxAnalysis() {
System.out.println("No syntax error detected");
}

public void codeOptimisation() {
System.out.println("Optimised Code");
}

public void generateParseTree() {
System.out.println("Parse tree generated");
}

public void file() {
System.out.println("Creating .exe file");
}

public int[] bits() {
int[] bit = { 1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1 };
return bit;
}
}

public class inheritance_in_interfaces {
public static void main(String[] args) {
VsCode myCode = new VsCode();
myCode.eliminateWhiteSpaces();
myCode.syntaxAnalysis();
myCode.codeOptimisation();
myCode.generateParseTree();
myCode.file();

for (int ele : myCode.bits()) {
System.out.print(ele);
}
}

// You have to implement a library using Java Class "Library"//
// Methods: addBook(), issueBook(), returnBook(), showAvailableBooks()
// Properties: Array to store the available AvailableBooks,
// Array to store the issued AvailableBooks

class Library{
String[] AvailableBooks = new String[100];
String[] IssuedBooks = new String[100];
int NumberOfAvailableBooks = 0;
int NumberOfIssuedBooks = 0;

void showAvailableBooks(){
System.out.println("The available books are: ");
for (int i = 0; i < this.AvailableBooks.length; i++){
if (this.AvailableBooks[i] == null){
continue;
}
System.out.println("* " + this.AvailableBooks[i]);
}
}
void showIssuedBooks(){
System.out.println("The issued books are: ");
for (int i = 0; i < this.IssuedBooks.length; i++){
if (this.IssuedBooks[i] == null){
continue;
}
System.out.println("* " + this.IssuedBooks[i]);
}
}
void addBook(String Book){
this.AvailableBooks[this.NumberOfAvailableBooks] = Book;
this.NumberOfAvailableBooks++;
System.out.println("The book " + Book + " has been added.");
}
void issueBook(String Book){
boolean BookFound = false;
for (int i = 0; i < this.AvailableBooks.length; i++) {
if (this.AvailableBooks[i] == Book){
// Remove the book from AvailableBooks Array
for (int j = i; j < this.AvailableBooks.length-1; j++) {
this.AvailableBooks[j] = this.AvailableBooks[j+1];
}
this.NumberOfAvailableBooks--;

// Add the book into IssuedBooks Array
this.IssuedBooks[this.NumberOfIssuedBooks] = Book;
NumberOfIssuedBooks++;

// Notify that the book has been issued
System.out.println("The book " + Book + " has been issued.");

// I found the book
BookFound = true;

// Break from the loop
break;

}
}
if (!BookFound){
System.out.println("The book you've entered is not available.");
}
}
void returnBook(String Book){
boolean IdentifyBook = false;
for (int i = 0; i < this.IssuedBooks.length; i++) {
if (this.IssuedBooks[i] == Book){
// Remove the book from IssuedBooks Array
for (int j = i; j < this.IssuedBooks.length-1; j++) {
this.IssuedBooks[j] = this.IssuedBooks[j+1];
}
this.NumberOfIssuedBooks--;

// Add the book in AvailableBooks Array
this.AvailableBooks[this.NumberOfAvailableBooks] = Book;
this.NumberOfAvailableBooks++;

// Confirm Identification
IdentifyBook = true;

// Break from the loop
break;

}
}

if (!IdentifyBook){
System.out.println("The book " + Book + " doesn't belong to our Library.");
}
}
}

package com.company;
class Library{
String[] Books;
String[] IssueBooks;
int noofbooks;
int issuedbooks;

public Library(){
Books=new String[100];
IssueBooks=new String[100];
noofbooks=0;
issuedbooks=0;
}
public void addBooks(String book){
for (int i = 0; i <=this.noofbooks ; i++) {
if (this.Books[i]==null){
this.Books[i]=book;
//System.out.println(this.Books[i]);
this.noofbooks++;
break;
}
}
System.out.println(book+" has been successfully added !!\n-------------------------------");
}
public void showAvailableBooks(){
System.out.println("The following books are available : ");
for (String book:this.Books){
if(book!=null)
System.out.println("* "+book);
}
System.out.println("-------------------------------");
}public void showIssuedBooks(){
System.out.println("The following books are issued to you: ");
for (String book:this.IssueBooks){
if(book!=null)
System.out.println("* "+book);
}
System.out.println("-------------------------------");
}
public void issueBooks(String book){
Boolean avl=false;
for (int i=0;i<=this.issuedbooks;i++) {
if (IssueBooks[i]==null){
this.IssueBooks[i]=book;
this.issuedbooks++;
avl=true;
break;
}
}
if (avl){
for (int i=0;i<=this.noofbooks;i++){
if (this.Books[i]==book){
this.Books[i]=null;
this.noofbooks--;
break;
}
}
System.out.println(book +" has been successfully issued to you !!\n-------------------------------");
}else{
System.out.println(book+" is not available !!\n-------------------------------");
}
}public void returnBooks(String book){
Boolean avl=false;
for (int i=0;i<this.issuedbooks;i++) {
if (book.equals(this.IssueBooks[i])){
this.IssueBooks[i]=null;
this.issuedbooks--;
avl=true;
break;
}
}
if (avl){
for (int i=0;i<this.noofbooks;i++){
if (this.Books[i]==null){
this.Books[i]=book;
this.noofbooks++;
break;
}
}
System.out.println(book +" has been successfully returned by you !!\n-------------------------------");
}else{
System.out.println(book+" has not been issued to you!!\n-------------------------------");
}
}
}

import java.util.Scanner;

class Library{

public Library(){
Books = new String[100];
Number_of_Books = 0;
}
public void BooksBagged(){
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.print("No. Of Books you will be adding: ");
BooksBagged = sc.nextInt();
}
public void addItem(){
for(Number_of_Books = 1 ; Number_of_Books <= BooksBagged ; Number_of_Books++) {
Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.print("Enter name of the " + Number_of_Books + " book: ");
Needed_Book = scanner.nextLine();
Books[Number_of_Books] = Needed_Book;
System.out.println( Needed_Book + " is added to cart");
}
System.out.print("Your items are added to the cart successfully!!");
}

public void cart(){
System.out.print("\nSo, Books added in your cart are: ");
for(String element : Books){
if (element == null){
continue;
}
System.out.print("\n");
System.out.print(":-> " + element);
}
System.out.print("\nRevise that you have added " + (Number_of_Books-1)+ " items in your cart.");
}

// I think this will be an useless function So, that's I will avoid this constructor.
}
}

class Library
{
private String availableBooks[]=new String[100];
private String issuedBooks[]=new String[100];

Library()
{
availableBooks[0]="The Jungle Book";
availableBooks[1]="Maha Bharat";
availableBooks[2]="Ramayan";
availableBooks[3]="The Merchant of Venice";
availableBooks[4]="The Invisible Man";
availableBooks[5]="Harry Potter";
availableBooks[6]="Believe It or Not";
availableBooks[7]="Maths";
availableBooks[8]="Computer";
}

void showAvailableBooks()
{
int c=0;
for(String i:availableBooks)
if(i!=null)
System.out.println(++c+". "+i);
if(c==0)
System.out.println("None!");
}

void showIssuedBooks()
{
int c=0;
for(String i:issuedBooks)
if(i!=null)
System.out.println(++c+". "+i);
if(c==0)
System.out.println("None!");
}


void addBook(String x)
{
int c=0;
for(String i:availableBooks)
{
if(i==null)
{
availableBooks[c]=x;
break;
}
c++;
}
System.out.println("Successfully Done.");
}

void issueBook(String x)
{
int c=0,c2=-1;
for(String i:availableBooks)
{
if(i!=null)
if(i.compareToIgnoreCase(x)==0)
{
for(String j:issuedBooks)
{
c2++;
if(j==null)
{
issuedBooks[c2]=availableBooks[c];
break;
}
}
availableBooks[c]=null;
System.out.println("The book \""+x+"\" is issued for you.");
break;
}
c++;
}
if(c2==-1)
System.out.println("Book Not Found!!");
}

void returnBook(String x)
{
int c=0,d=0;
for(String i:issuedBooks)
{
if(i!=null)
if(i.compareToIgnoreCase(x)==0)
{
d=1;
addBook(i);
issuedBooks[c]=null;
break;
}
c++;
}
if(d==0)
System.out.println("Check your entry");
}
}

Multiprogramming – A computer running more than one program at a time (like running Excel and Firefox simultaneously).
Multiprocessing – A computer using more than one CPU at a time.
Multitasking – Tasks sharing a common resource (like 1 CPU).
Multithreading is an extension of multitasking. class MyThreadRunnable1 implements Runnable{
@Override
public void run() {
int i = 0;
while (i<4000){
System.out.println("This is My thread 1 Not a Thread 1");
i++;
}
}
}

class MyThreadRunnable2 implements Runnable{
@Override
public void run() {
int i = 0;
while (i<4000) {
System.out.println("This is My thread 2 Not a Thread 2");
i++;
}
}
}


public class Chapter13RunnableInterface {
public static void main(String[] args) {

MyThreadRunnable1 bullet1 = new MyThreadRunnable1();
Thread gun1 = new Thread(bullet1);

MyThreadRunnable2 bullet2 = new MyThreadRunnable2();
Thread gun2 = new Thread(bullet2);

gun1.start();
gun2.start();

}

class MyThready2 implements Runnable{
public MyThready2(Runnable run, String name) {
// super(run, name); // super only works incase of inheritance not interface
System.out.println("This is a thread implements via runnable interface");
}

@Override
public void run() {
int i = 0;
while (i < 20) {
System.out.println("I am a thread");
i++;
}
}
}
public class Cwh_73 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
MyThready2 t1 = new MyThready2(null,"Harry");
MyThready2 t2 = new MyThready2(null,"Jenny");
Thread fort1 = new Thread(t1);
Thread fort2 = new Thread(t2);
fort1.start();
fort2.start();
System.out.println("The id of thread t1 is " + fort1.getId());
System.out.println("The id of thread t1 is " + fort1.getName());
System.out.println("The id of thread t1 is " + fort1.getState());
System.out.println("The id of thread t2 is " + fort2.getId());
System.out.println("The id of thread t2 is " + fort2.getName());
System.out.println("The id of thread t2 is " + fort2.getState());
}
}

public void run()
{ int i=20;
while(i>10)
{
System.out.println("I am a runnable thread");
i--;
}
}
}
public class runnable_data_type
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
MyThr bullet1 = new MyThr();
Thread gun1 = new Thread(bullet1);//here we create runnable type object.


/* we cant create runnable type object like this:
* Runnable obj = new Runnable();
* this is because since Runnable is an interface, not a class, it cant be instantiated(i.e, we can't
* create its object).
*/

/* this one is to send the "Runnable" type object as an argument in a thread that is
* created by implementing the runnable interface.
*/
myth bullet2 = new myth(bullet1,"malay");
Thread gun2 = new Thread(bullet2);
gun2.start();
System.out.println(gun2.getId());
System.out.println(gun2.getName());


}
}

}

public class Chapter13PracticeSet {
public static void main(String[] args) throws InterruptedException {

// Problem 1
GoodMorning gm = new GoodMorning();
Welcome wc = new Welcome();

// gm.start();
// wc.start();

// Problem 2
GoodMorning2 gm2 = new GoodMorning2();
gm2.setName("Good Morning 2");
Welcome2 wc2 = new Welcome2();
wc2.setName("Welcome 2");

//gm2.start();
//wc2.start();

// Problem 3
gm.setPriority(Thread.MAX_PRIORITY); // 10
gm2.setPriority(Thread.NORM_PRIORITY); // 5
wc.setPriority(Thread.MIN_PRIORITY); // 1
System.out.println(gm.getPriority());
System.out.println(gm2.getPriority());
System.out.println(wc.getPriority());

// Problem 4
System.out.println(gm.getState());
System.out.println(gm2.getState());
System.out.println(wc.getState());
System.out.println(wc2.getState());

// Problem 5
Welcome3 wc3 = new Welcome3();
wc3.setName("Welcome 3");
wc3.start();
Thread t1 = Thread.currentThread();
t1.setName("Current Thread");
System.out.println("The State of Current Thread is: "+ wc3.getState());

for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
System.out.println("The State of Current Thread is: "+ t1.getState());
System.out.println("The name of Current Thread is: "+ t1.currentThread().getName());

package com.codewithharry.shape;

class Rectangle {
int length,width;
//setters
public void setWidth(int width){
this.width=width;
}
public void setLength(int length){
this.length=length;
}
//getters
public int getWidth(){
return width;
}
public int getLength(){
return length;
}
//methods
public void area(){
System.out.println("Rectangle's area is "+width*length);
}
public void perimeter(){
System.out.println("Rectangle perimeter is "+2*(length+width));
}
}

class Square extends Rectangle{
public void area (){
System.out.println("Square area is "+length*length);
}
public void perimeter(){
System.out.println("Square perimeter is "+4*length);
}
}

class Cylinder {
int radius,height;
//setters
public void setHeight(int height){
this.height=height;
}
public void setRadius(int radius){
this.radius=radius;
}
//getters
public int getHeight(){
return height;
}
public int getRadius(){
return radius;
}
//methods
public void surfaceArea(){
System.out.println("Cylinder surface area is "+(2*Math.PI*radius*height)+(2*Math.PI*radius*radius));
}
public void volume(){
System.out.println("Cylinder volume is "+Math.PI*radius*radius*height);
}
}

class Sphere extends Cylinder{
public void surfaceArea(){
System.out.println("Sphere surface area is "+4*Math.PI*radius*radius);
}
}

class Circle extends Sphere{
public void area(){
System.out.println("Circle area is "+Math.PI*radius*radius);
}
}

public class Challenge{
public static void main(String [] args){
Cylinder c=new Sphere();
c.setRadius(5);
c.surfaceArea();
}

import java.util.Scanner;

public class exception {
public static int abc(int[] y) {

Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.println("Enter the index of the array");
int x = sc.nextInt();
try {
return y[x];
}
catch (Exception e) {
System.out.println(e);

return abc(y);
}
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
int array[]={23,65,45,12,99,65,78,12};
System.out.println( abc(array));
}

Second time i am see this video then i understand the custom class & throw keyword 😅 I have a doubt here, why didn't you create a MyException class in the main method. Is it possible to access directly without creating the MyException class Object. sir why did you use @Override because both of the method are different and also, why did you use super keyword, because you are actually calling a method inside the class, not, you are confusing me sir To those who are confused that when and how was the object of the custom class created,
Just create an object the way you are used to (say),
MyException obj = new MyException();
and then use throw like , throw obj;
It will work exactly the same way as it did in the program.I don't think its a rocket science to know that both works the same way and really sad to see the comment section doubting him just due to this.:(
I mean come on , you are watching the 83rd video and still not clear about objects(how they are created) ??
Whenever you write something like say,
MyException obj = new MyException();
Then its the RHS that actually instantiates/create the objects The LHS is just used to give a name(obj) that will refer to the created object so that you can use it whenever required But computer mandatorily don't need a name to refer the object to It knows where it has created object So even though you don't assign any name to refer with, it doesn't mean no object is created.Just write the RHS and then and there an object is created.
Doesn't mean to offend anyone just saying that having reached 83rd video, if you are still.not clear about this , then surely the teacher should not be blamed.
Its as if you will question someone when he writes like:
MyException obj;
obj=new MyException();

Just because he taught you to write like:
MyException obj=new MyException();

You can even go back to sheer basics
Remember Class can be thought of as a data type with object as its variable(relatively) So just think,Don't:
int a = 5;return a;
OR
int a;a=5;return a;
OR
return 5;
mean the same thing??Here also its the same just think of "MyException" as "int" and "obj" as "a". harry=coding ka mahasagar😁

// made by Aman Sharma

import java.util.Scanner;

class InvalidInputException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "you have given the wrong input!! This is not the valid input for calculation";
}
}
class CannotDivideBy0Exception extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "divide any value by 0 is not possible in mathematics";
}
}
class MaxInputException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "the input value cannot be exceed 100000";
}
}
class MaxMultiplierReachedException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "the input for multiplication can not be exceed 70000";
}
}


public class customcalculator{
public static void addition(double a,double b){
System.out.print("Answer is: ");
System.out.println(a+b);
}
public static void substraction(double a,double b){
System.out.print("Answer is: ");
System.out.println(a-b);
}
public static void multiplication(double a,double b){
try{
if(a>7000 || b>7000){
throw new MaxMultiplierReachedException();
}
System.out.println("Answer is: ");
System.out.println(a*b);
}
catch(Exception e){
System.out.println(e);
}


}
public static void division(double a,double b){

try{
if(b==0){
throw new CannotDivideBy0Exception();
}
System.out.println("Answer is: ");
System.out.println(a/b);
}
catch(Exception e){
System.out.println(e);
}

}

public static void main(String[] args){
Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);

System.out.println("give value 1");
double a=sc.nextDouble();
System.out.println("give value 2");
double b=sc.nextDouble();
System.out.println("what will you want to do with this values");
String str=sc.next();

try{

if(a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
try{
if(str.equals("+")){
addition(a,b);
}
else if(str.equals("-")){
substraction(a,b);
}
else if(str.equals("*")){
multiplication(a,b);
}
else if(str.equals("/")){
division(a,b);
}
else{
throw new InvalidInputException();
}
}
catch(Exception e){
System.out.println(e);
}
}
catch(Exception e){
System.out.println(e);
}

}
} Challenge Excepted

package com.companey;

import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException;

class InvalidInput extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString(){
return "Invalid input exception / Exeption";
}
@Override
public String getMessage(){
return "Why you are entering 8 , 9 ";
}
}
class MaxInput extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString(){
return "Max Input greater then, 100000";
}
@Override
public String getMessage(){
return "why you are using greater than 1lac value";
}
}
class MaxMultiplierReached extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString(){
return " Max Multiplier Reached";
}
@Override
public String getMessage(){
return "why you are using above value of 7000";
}
}
class CantDivByZero extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString(){
return "Divided by / Zero Exception";
}
@Override
public String getMessage(){
return "Why your are entering Zero for division!";
}
}
class DivLaterValue extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString(){
return "dive by value is big";
}
@Override
public String getMessage(){
return "why your are entering div by value in here";
}
}
class CostumeCalculator{
public void add(int a, int b) /*throws MaxInput, InvalidInput*/ {
try {
if (a<100000 && b<100000) {
try {
if (a!=8 && b!=8 && a!=9 && b!=9){
System.out.println(a+b);
}
else {
throw new InvalidInput();
}
}catch (InvalidInput i){
System.out.println(i);
}
}
else {
throw new MaxInput();
}
}catch (MaxInput m){
System.out.println(m);
}
}
public void sub(int a, int b) /*throws MaxInput*/ {
try {
if (a<100000 && b<100000) {
try {
if (a!=8 && b!=8 && a!=9 && b!=9){
System.out.println(a-b);
}
else {
throw new InvalidInput();
}
}catch (InvalidInput i){
System.out.println(i);
}
}
else {
throw new MaxInput();
}
}
catch (MaxInput e){
System.out.println(e);
}


}
public void multiply(int a, int b)/* throws MaxInput, MaxMultiplierReached*/{
try {
if (a<100000 && b<100000) {
try {
if (a<7000 && b<7000) {
try {
if (a!=8 && b!=8 && a!=9 && b!=9){
System.out.println(a*b);
}
else {
throw new InvalidInput();
}
}catch (InvalidInput i){
System.out.println(i);
}
}
else {
throw new MaxMultiplierReached();
}
} catch (MaxMultiplierReached e) {
System.out.println(e);
}
}
else {
throw new MaxInput();
}
}
catch (MaxInput e){
System.out.println(e);
}

}
public void Div(int a, int b) /*throws MaxInput ,CantDivByZero , DivLaterValue */{

try {
if (a>=b) {
try {
if (a<100000 && b<100000) {
try {
if (b != 0) {
try {
if (a!=8 && b!=8 && a!=9 && b!=9){
System.out.println(a/b);
}
else {
throw new InvalidInput();
}
}catch (InvalidInput i){
System.out.println(i);
}
}
else {
throw new CantDivByZero();
}
} catch (CantDivByZero e) {
System.out.println(e);
System.out.println(e.getMessage());
}
}
else {
throw new MaxInput();
}
}
catch (MaxInput e){
System.out.println(e);
}
}
else {
throw new DivLaterValue();
}
}catch (DivLaterValue e){
System.out.println(e);
}

}
}
public class Cwh_87_Exercise6_Custom_Calculator {
public static void main(String[] args){
CostumeCalculator cl = new CostumeCalculator();
cl.add(10,3);
cl.sub(10,2);
cl.multiply(10, 2);
cl.Div(10,2);


}
} Challenge Accepted challenge accepted import java.util.Scanner;
class InvalidInputException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "Cannot add 8 and 9";
}
public String getMessage(){
return "I am getMessage";
}
}
class MaxInputException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "Cannot greater than 100000";
}
public String getMessage(){
return "I am getMessage";
}
}
class MaxMultiplyInputException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "Cannot multiply greater than 7000";
}
public String getMessage(){
return "I am getMessage";
}
}
class CannotDivideByZeroException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "Cannot divide by 0";
}
public String getMessage(){
return "I am getMessage";
}
}

class CustomCalculator {
double add(double a, double b)throws InvalidInputException,MaxInputException{
if (a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
if (a == 8 || b == 9){
throw new InvalidInputException();
}
return a + b;
}

double subtract(double a, double b) throws MaxInputException{
if (a > 100000 || b > 100000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
return a - b;
}
double multiply(double a, double b) throws MaxMultiplyInputException{
if (a > 7000 || b > 7000){
throw new MaxMultiplyInputException();
}
return a * b;
}
double divide(double a, double b) throws CannotDivideByZeroException{
if (a > 7000 || b > 7000){
throw new CannotDivideByZeroException();
}
return a / b;
}
}
public class cwh_87_practice_question_06 {
public static void main(String[] args) throws InvalidInputException ,MaxInputException,MaxMultiplyInputException,CannotDivideByZeroException{
CustomCalculator c = new CustomCalculator();

// c.multiply(8000,8000);
c.divide(180,0);
}
} package com.company;

import java.util.Scanner;

class InvalidInputException extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "This input is invalid (TRY: +,-,*,/)";
}
}
class MaxInputException extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Input exceeds the limit (TRY: lower than 100000";
}
}
class MaxMultiplierReachedException extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Multiplier limit cannot exceed 7000";
}
}
public class cwh_87_ex6 {
public static void main(String[] args) throws InvalidInputException, ArithmeticException, MaxInputException, MaxMultiplierReachedException {

Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
try {
System.out.print("Enter an integer -> ");
int a = sc.nextInt();
System.out.print("Enter the function (+,-,*,/) -> ");
String fun = sc.next();
System.out.print("Enter the integer -> ");
int b = sc.nextInt();

if (a >100000 || b > 100000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
else if (fun.equals("*")){
if (a > 7000 || b > 7000){
throw new MaxMultiplierReachedException();
}
}
switch (fun) {
case "-" -> System.out.println("= " + (a - b));
case "+" -> System.out.println("= " + a + b);
case "*" -> System.out.println("= " + a * b);
case "/" -> System.out.println("= " + a / b);
default -> {
System.out.println();
throw new InvalidInputException();
}
}
}
catch (ArithmeticException e) {
System.out.println("\n" + e);
}
}
} import java.util.Scanner;

class ZeroDivideException extends Exception {

public class chapter_14_CalculatorApp {

public static void calculator(int num1, int num2) throws ZeroDivideException, MaxInputException, MaxMultiplierException {
if (num1 > 10000 || num2 > 10000)
throw new MaxInputException();

String ch;
System.out.println("+, -, * , / ");
System.out.print("Enter your choice of operation: ");
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
ch = sc.next();
switch (ch) {
case "+": {
System.out.println(num1 + num2);
break;
}
case "-": {
System.out.println(num1 - num2);
break;
}
case "*": {
if (num1 >= 7000 || num2 >= 7000)
throw new MaxMultiplierException();
else
System.out.println(num1 * num2);
break;
}
case "/": {
if (num2 == 0)
throw new ZeroDivideException();
else
System.out.println(num1 / num2);
break;
}
default:
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unexpected value: " + ch);
}
}

int num1, num2;
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);

while (true) {

System.out.println("Enter your num1 and num2");

num2 = sc.nextInt();
calculator(num1, num2);
break; // Exit the loop if calculation is successful
} catch (InputMismatchException e) {
System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter valid integers.");
sc.nextLine(); // Consume the invalid input
} catch (Exception e) {
System.out.println(e.getMessage());
}
}

sc.close(); // Close the Scanner
}

class CustomCalculator{
public int a,b;


public void getData() {

System.out.println("Enter B");
b = sc.nextInt();
}

public int add() throws MaxInputException{
if(a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException("Number should be under 100000");
}
return a+b;
}

public int sub() throws MaxInputException{
if(a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException("Number should be under 100000");
}
return a-b;
}

public int multiply() throws MaxInputException,MaxMultiplierReachedException{
if(a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException("Number should be under 100000");
}
else if(a>7000 || b>7000){
throw new MaxMultiplierReachedException("Its exceed 7000");
}

return a*b;
}

public int divide() throws MaxInputException, DivideByZero{
if(a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException("Number should be under 100000");
}
if(b==0){
throw new DivideByZero("Cannot be Divided by zero");
}
return a/b;
}

public void selectOp() throws MaxInputException, MaxMultiplierReachedException, DivideByZero{
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);

String operator = sc.next();

switch(operator){

case "+":
result = add();
System.out.println("The Addition is "+result);

case "-":
result = sub();
System.out.println("The Substraction is "+result);
break;

case "*":
result = multiply();
System.out.println("The Multiplication is "+result);
break;

case "/":
result = divide();
System.out.println("The Division is "+result);
break;

default:
System.out.println("Invalid Character");
}
}

}

if (a > 7000 || b > 7000) {
throw new Calculator2("Max input Exception: input should not be greater than 7000");
}
return a * b;
}

public static float divide(int a, int b) throws Calculator2 {

throw new Calculator2("Max input Exception: input should not be greater than 7000");
}
if (b == 0) {

}
return (float) a / b;
}

class InvalidInputException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "Enter a valid input";
}
}

class DivisionException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "Cannot divide by 0";
}
}

class MaxInputException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "Cannot take inputs greater than 100000";
}
}

class MultiplicationException extends Exception{
public String toString(){
return "Cannot multiply if an input is greater than 7000";
}
}

class Calculator{
String [] operators={"+","-","*","/"};
int unavailability=0;
public void calculator(int num1,String operator,int num2){
for(String element:operators){
if(element!=operator){
unavailability++;
if(unavailability==4){
try{
throw new InvalidInputException();
}catch(InvalidInputException e){
System.out.println(e);
}
}
}
else{
if(operator=="/"&&num2==0){
try{
throw new DivisionException();
}catch(DivisionException e){
System.out.println(e);
break;
}
}
else if(num1>100000||num2>100000){
try{
throw new MaxInputException();
}catch(MaxInputException e){
System.out.println(e);
break;
}
}
else if(operator=="*"&&num1>7000||num2>7000){
try{
throw new MultiplicationException();
}
catch(MultiplicationException e){
System.out.println(e);
break;
}
}
switch(operator){
case "+"->System.out.println("Result is "+(num1+num2));
case "/"->System.out.println("Result is "+(num1/num2));
case "*"->System.out.println("Result is "+(num1*num2));
case "-"->System.out.println("Result is "+(num1-num2));
}
}
}
}

class InputException extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString()
{
return "Invalid input";
}
}
class MultipleException extends Exception
{
@Override
public String toString()
{
return "Invalid input for multiplication";
}
}
class DivisionException extends Exception
{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Can not divide by zero";
}
}

class Calculator{
public void addition(double a, double b)
{
double c = 0;
try {
c = a + b;
if (a == 8 || b==8 || a==9 || b==9 || a>100000 || b>100000) {
throw new InputException();
}
else
System.out.println("Result after addition is: " +c);
} catch (InputException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
}
public void subtraction(double a, double b)
{
double c = 0;
try {
c = a - b;
if (a == 8 || b==8 || a==9 || b==9 || a>100000 || b>100000) {
throw new InputException();
}
else
System.out.println("Result after subtraction is:" +c);
} catch (InputException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
}
public void Multiplication(double a, double b)
{
double c = 0;
try {
c = a*b;
if (a == 8 || b==8 || a==9 || b==9) {
throw new InputException();
} else if (a>7000 || b>7000 )
{
throw new MultipleException();
} else
System.out.println("Result after multiplication is:" +c);
} catch (InputException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
catch (MultipleException e){
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
}
public void Division(double a, double b)
{
double c = 0;
try {
c = a/b;
if (a == 8 || b==8 || a==9 || b==9 || a>100000 || b>100000) {
throw new InputException();
} else if (a==0 || b==0)
{
throw new DivisionException();
} else
System.out.println("Result after division is:" +c);
} catch (InputException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
catch (DivisionException e){
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
}
}

import java.util.Scanner; // Some custom exception which can be raised class InvalidInputException extends Exception{ @Override public String toString(){ return "Invalid operator input encountered.."; } } class DivideByZeroException extends Exception{ @Override public String toString(){ return "Tooofan can't divide by zero..."; } } class MaxInputException extends Exception{ @Override public String toString(){ return "Any of the operands can't be greater than 100000"; } } class MaxMultiplierReachedException extends Exception{ @Override public String toString(){ return "Can't multiply with a number greater than 7000"; } } // Calculator class class Calculator{ // Basic Operations public double add(double a,double b){ return a+b; } public double subtract(double a,double b){ return a-b; } public double multiply(double a,double b){ return a*b; } public double divide(double a,double b){ return a/b; } // run calculate() to use calculator public double calculate(String expression) throws InvalidInputException, DivideByZeroException,MaxInputException,MaxMultiplierReachedException{ double operandOne; double operandTwo; char operator = ' '; double Result; // parsing operands and operators from input string int i=0; String operandOneStr = ""; String operandTwoStr = ""; while(expression.charAt(i) != ' '){ operandOneStr+=expression.charAt(i); i++; } i++; operandOne = Double.parseDouble(operandOneStr); while (expression.charAt(i) != ' '){ operator = expression.charAt(i); i++; } for(;i<expression.length();i++){ operandTwoStr+=expression.charAt(i); } operandTwo = Double.parseDouble(operandTwoStr); // checking inputs and throwing exceptions when required if (operandTwo == 0 && operator == '/'){ throw new DivideByZeroException(); } if (operandOne>100000 || operandTwo>100000){ throw new MaxInputException(); } if (operandTwo>7000 && operator == '*'){ throw new MaxMultiplierReachedException(); } // now using switch on operator switch(operator){ case '+': Result = this.add(operandOne,operandTwo); break; case '-': Result = this.subtract(operandOne,operandTwo); break; case '*': Result = this.multiply(operandOne,operandTwo); break; case '/': Result = this.divide(operandOne,operandTwo); break; default: throw new InvalidInputException(); } return Result; } } // Main class public class Main{ public static void main(String args[]){ Calculator machine = new Calculator(); // getting expression Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); System.out.print("Enter expression [only work for two operands] >> "); String expression = sc.nextLine(); try{ double answer = machine.calculate(expression); System.out.println(answer); } catch(InvalidInputException e1){ e1.printStackTrace(); } catch(DivideByZeroException e2){ e2.printStackTrace(); } catch(MaxInputException e3){ e3.printStackTrace(); } catch(MaxMultiplierReachedException e4){ e4.printStackTrace(); } finally{ System.out.println("Program Finished!!!"); } } } package com.company;
import java.util.Scanner;

class InvalidInputException extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Invalid input: CAN'T ADD ZERO";
}

@Override
public String getMessage() {
return "Invalid input: CAN'T ADD ZERO";
}
}
class CannotDivideByZeroException extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Error: CAN'T DIVIDE BY ZERO";
}

@Override
public String getMessage() {
return "Error: CAN'T DIVIDE BY ZERO";
}
}
class MaxInputException extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Error: INPUT CANNOT BE GREATER THAN 1,00,000";
}

@Override
public String getMessage() {
return "Error: INPUT CANNOT BE GREATER THAN 1,00,000";
}
}
class MaxMultiplyInputException extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Error: INPUT CANNOT BE GREATER THAN 7000";
}

@Override
public String getMessage() {
return "Error: INPUT CANNOT BE GREATER THAN 7000";
}
}

class CustomCalculator{
double add(double a, double b) throws InvalidInputException, MaxInputException{
if (a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
if (a==0 || b==0){
throw new InvalidInputException();
}
return a+b;
}
double subtract(double a, double b) throws MaxInputException{
if (a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
return a-b;
}
double multiply(double a, double b) throws MaxInputException, MaxMultiplyInputException{
if (a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
else if (a> 7000 || b>7000){
throw new MaxMultiplyInputException();
}
return a*b;
}
double divide(double a, double b) throws CannotDivideByZeroException, MaxInputException{
if (a>100000 || b>100000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
if (b==0){
throw new CannotDivideByZeroException();
}
return a/b;
}
}

System.out.print("\nEnter value of b: ");

System.out.print("\n\nSelect: ");

double add = c.add(a, b);

} else if (select == 2){

System.out.println("Subtraction: "+sub);
} else if (select == 3){
double mul = c.multiply(a, b);
System.out.println("Multiplication: "+mul);
} else if (select == 4){
double div = c.divide(a, b);
System.out.println("Division: "+div);
} else {
System.out.println("INVALID INPUT!!");
}
}

import java.util.Scanner;

class operatorException extends Exception{

return "Please select proper operator";
}
}
class maxInputException extends Exception{
public String getMessage(){
return "Input limit < 100000";
}
}
class multiplierReachedException extends Exception{
public String getMessage(){
return "Multiplier input limit < 7000";
}

public class Exercise_6 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.print("Enter num_1: ");
int a = sc.nextInt();
try {
if (a > 100000) {
throw new maxInputException();
}
try {
System.out.print("Choose your arithmetic operator(+, -, *, /): ");
char op = sc.next().charAt(0);
System.out.print("Enter num_2: ");
int b = sc.nextInt();
try {
if (b > 100000) {
throw new maxInputException();
} else if (op == '*' && a >= 7000 || op == '*' && b >= 7000) {
throw new multiplierReachedException();
}
calculator(a, b, op);
} catch (Exception e) {
System.out.println(e.getMessage());
}
} catch (Exception f) {
System.out.println(f.getMessage());
}
} catch (Exception g) {
System.out.println(g.getMessage());
}
}

public static void calculator(int num1, int num2, char operator)throws multiplierReachedException,maxInputException,ArithmeticException{
switch (operator){
case '+':
System.out.println("The result is " + (num1+num2));
break;
case '-':
System.out.println("The result is " + (num1-num2));
break;
case '*':
try{
if(num1>=7000 || num2>=7000 ){
throw new multiplierReachedException();
}
System.out.println("The result is " + (num1*num2));
}
catch(Exception e) {
System.out.println(e.getMessage());
}
break;
case '/':
try{
System.out.println("The result is " + (num1/num2));
}
catch(ArithmeticException e){
System.out.println("Cannot divide by zero! ");
}
break;
default :
try {
throw new operatorException();
}
catch(Exception e){
System.out.println(e.getMessage());
}
}
}

public class calculator
{
public double add(double x,double y)
{
return x+y;
}

public double sub(double x,double y)
{
return x-y;
}

public double mult(double x,double y)
{
if(x>7000.0||y>7000.0)
{
try
{
throw new MaxMultiplierReachedException();
}
catch(Exception e)
{
System.out.println(e);
}
return -1;
}
else
return x*y;
}

public double div(double x,double y)
{
try{
double d=x/y;
return d;
}
catch(Exception e)
{
System.out.println(e);
}
return -1;
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
Scanner SC=new Scanner(System.in);
calculator obj=new calculator();

double a=SC.nextDouble();
double b=SC.nextDouble();
if(a>10000.0||b>10000.0)
{
try{
throw new MaxInputReachedException();
}
catch(Exception e)
{
System.out.println(e);
}
}
else
{
System.out.println("CALCULATOR OPTIONS");

int c=SC.nextInt();
System.out.println("--OUTPUT--");
switch(c)
{
case 1:
System.out.println("Addition: "+obj.add(a,b));
break;
case 2:
System.out.println(a+" - "+b+" = "+obj.sub(a,b));
System.out.println(b+" - "+a+" = "+obj.sub(b,a));
break;
case 3:System.out.println("Multiplication: "+obj.mult(a,b));
break;
case 4: System.out.println(a+"/"+b+"= "+obj.div(a,b));
System.out.println(b+"/"+a+"= "+obj.div(b,a));
break;

default: System.out.println("INVALID OPTION");
}
}
}

class CustomCalculator {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
char op;
try{
System.out.print("Enter an operator to proceed - ");
op = sc.next().charAt(0);
switch(op){
case '+':
double sum = 0.0;
System.out.println("Enter numbers - ");
while(true){
double n = sc.nextDouble();
if (n>100000)
throw new MaxInputException();
sum+=n;
if(n==0){
System.out.println(sum);
break;
}
}
break;
case '-':
int iter = 1;
double diff = 0.0;
System.out.println("Enter numbers - ");
while(true){
double n = sc.nextDouble();
if (n>100000)
throw new MaxInputException();

else if (iter==1)
diff=n;
else{
diff-=n;
}
if(n==0){
System.out.println(diff);
break;
}
iter++;
}
break;

case '*':
double product = 1.0;
System.out.println("Enter numbers - ");
while(true){
double n = sc.nextDouble();
if (n>7000)
throw new MaxMultiplierReachedException();
product*=n;
if(n==1){
System.out.println(product);
break;
}
}
break;

case '/':
double div = 0.0,dividend,divisor;
System.out.print("Enter dividend - ");
dividend = sc.nextDouble();
System.out.print("Enter divisor - ");
divisor = sc.nextDouble();
if (dividend>100000||divisor>100000)
throw new MaxInputException();

else if (divisor==0)
throw new CannotDivideBy0Exception();
else{
div = dividend/divisor;
System.out.println(div);
}
break;

default:
throw new InvalidInputException();
}
}

catch(MaxInputException m){
System.out.println(m);
}
catch(MaxMultiplierReachedException e){
System.out.println(e);
}
catch(CannotDivideBy0Exception c){
System.out.println(c);
}
catch(InvalidInputException inp){
System.out.println(inp);
}
}

System.out.print("Enter your number 2: ");

try {

}
}

else{
switch (Operator) {

System.out.println("Result is: "+(num1+num2));
break;
case "-":

case "*":

break;

finally{

double subtract(double a,double b) throws MaxInputException {
if(a>1000||b>1000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
return a-b;
}
double multiply(double a,double b)throws MaxInputException,MaxMultiplyReached{
if(a>7000||b>7000){
throw new MaxMultiplyReached();
}
if(a>1000||b>1000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
return a*b;
}
double divide(double a,double b) throws CannotDivideZeroException,MaxInputException{
if(a>1000||b>1000){
throw new MaxInputException();
}
if(b==0){
throw new CannotDivideZeroException();
}
return a/b;
}
}

class Calculator{
public int a;
public int b;

else {
throw new invalidInputException();
}
if(sc1.hasNextInt()) {
this.b = sc1.nextInt();
if (b > 100000) {
throw new maxInputException();
}
}
else {
throw new invalidInputException();
}

}
public int addition(){
return this.a+this.b;
}
public int subtraction(){
return this.a-this.b;
}
public int multiplication() throws maxMultipleirReachedException{

return this.a * this.b;
}
else {
throw new maxMultipleirReachedException();
}
}
public int division() throws cannotDivideByZeroException{

return this.b / this.a;
}
else {
throw new cannotDivideByZeroException();
}
}
}

public static float calculate(int a, int b, String sign){
if (sign.equals("+")){
if (a < 100000 || b < 100000){
try{
return a+b;
}catch (ArithmeticException e){
e.printStackTrace();
}
}else {
try {
throw new AmountError();
} catch (AmountError amountError) {
amountError.printStackTrace();
}
}
}else if (sign.equals("-")){
if (a < 100000 || b < 100000){
try{
return a-b;
}catch (ArithmeticException e){
e.printStackTrace();
}
}else {
try {
throw new AmountError();
} catch (AmountError amountError) {
amountError.printStackTrace();
}
}
}else if (sign.equals("*")){
if (a < 7000 || b < 7000){
try{
return a*b;
}catch (ArithmeticException e){
e.printStackTrace();
}
}else {
try {
throw new AmountError();
} catch (AmountError amountError) {
amountError.printStackTrace();
}
}
}else if (sign.equals("/")){
if (a < 100000 || b < 100000){
try{
return a/b;
}catch (ArithmeticException e){
e.printStackTrace();
}
}else {
try {
throw new AmountError();
} catch (AmountError amountError) {
amountError.printStackTrace();
}
}
}else {
try {
throw new SignError();
} catch (SignError signError) {
signError.printStackTrace();
}
}
return 0;
}

}

class AmountError extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Enter amount valid amount.";
}
}

class SignError extends Exception{
@Override
public String toString() {
return "Enter valid sign.";
}

class InvalidInputException extends Exception {
public String toString() {
return "java.lang.InvalidInputException";
}
public String getMessage() {
return "this an input exception";
}
}
class MaxInputException extends Exception {
public String toString() {
return "java.lang.MaxInputException";
}
public String getMessage() {
return "this a maximum input exception exception";
}
}
class MaxMultiplierException extends Exception {
public String toString() {
return "java.lang.MaxMultiplierException";
}
public String getMessage() {
return "this a maximum multiplier reached exception";
}
}
class DivideByZeroException extends Exception {
public String toString() {
return "java.lang.DivideByZeroException";
}
public String getMessage() {
return "this a divide by 0 exception";
}
}
class Operation {
double Calc(double a, double b, String op) {

double c = 0;
try {
if (a > 100000 || b > 100000) {
throw new MaxInputException();
}
switch (op) {
case "+":
c = a + b;
break;
case "-":
c = a - b;
break;
case "*":
if (a > 7000 || b > 7000) {
throw new MaxMultiplierException();
}
c = a * b;
break;
case "/":
if (b == 0) {
throw new DivideByZeroException();
}
c = a / b;
break;
default :
throw new InvalidInputException();
}
} catch (Exception e) {
System.out.println("error.....☠️" + e);
}
return c;
}
}

public class E03_CustomCalculator {
public static void main(String[] args) {

try {
System.out.println("Enter The Operation you need to perform in one line leaving space for another input");
int a = sc.nextInt();
char operation = sc.next().charAt(0);
int b = sc.nextInt();
boolean accessible = true;
if (b > 100000 || a > 100000) {
try {
throw new maxInputException();
} catch (maxInputException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
accessible = false;
} else if (((a > 7000) || (b > 7000)) && (operation == '*')) {
try {
throw new maxMultiplicationException();
} catch (maxMultiplicationException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
accessible = false;
}
if (accessible) {
switch (operation) {
case '+' -> System.out.println(a + b);
case '-' -> System.out.println(a - b);
case '*' -> {
try {
System.out.println(a * b);
} catch (ArithmeticException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
}
case '/' -> {
try {
System.out.println(a / b);
} catch (ArithmeticException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
}
default -> {
try {
throw new invalidInputException();
} catch (invalidInputException e) {
System.out.println(e.toString());
}
}
}
}
}catch (Exception e){

}

If the list fits in the specified array, it is returned therein. Otherwise, a new array is allocated with the runtime type of the specified array and the size of this list.
If the list fits in the specified array with room to spare (i.e., the array has more elements than the list), the element in the array immediately following the end of the collection is set to null. public class j_92_linkedlist {
public static void main(String[] args) {

LinkedList<String> animal1 = new LinkedList<>();
animal1.add("hours");
animal1.add("cat");
animal1.add("dog");
animal1.add("elephant");
System.out.println("linked list :- "+animal1);

animal1.add(1, "tiger");
System.out.println("updated Linked list :- "+animal1);

// get the element from the linked list
String str = animal1.get(1);
System.out.println("element at index 1 :- "+str);

// change elements at index 3
animal1.set(2,"lion");
System.out.println("Change Element From Element 2"+animal1);

// remove elements from index 1
String str1 = animal1.remove(3);
System.out.println("Remove Element:- "+str1);

System.out.println("updated Element"+animal1);


// access the first element
String str1 = languages.peek();
System.out.println("Accessed Element: " + str1);

// access and remove the first element
String str2 = languages.poll();
System.out.println("Removed Element: " + str2);
System.out.println("LinkedList after poll(): " + languages);

// add element at the end
languages.offer("Swift");
System.out.println("LinkedList after offer(): " + languages);
}
